name: gobekli-tepe
description: The world's oldest known temple complex was built in modern-day Turkey.

name: jericho-walls
description: One of the earliest known permanent settlements constructed defensive walls.

name: catalhoyuk-settlement
description: One of the world's first urban settlements thrived in Anatolia.

name: stonehenge-begins
description: Construction began on the iconic prehistoric monument in England.

name: great-pyramid-giza
description: The largest Egyptian pyramid was built as a tomb for Pharaoh Khufu.

name: sphinx-built
description: The massive limestone statue with a lion's body and human head was carved.

name: ziggurat-ur
description: The Sumerians constructed a massive stepped temple in ancient Mesopotamia.

name: palace-knossos
description: The Minoans built the legendary palace complex on the island of Crete.

name: lion-gate-mycenae
description: The iconic entrance to the citadel of Mycenae was constructed in Greece.

name: solomons-temple
description: The First Temple was built in Jerusalem as the center of Jewish worship.

name: rome-founded
description: According to legend, Romulus founded the city of Rome.

name: cloaca-maxima
description: Rome constructed one of the world's earliest sewage systems.

name: persepolis-founded
description: Darius the Great began building the ceremonial capital of the Persian Empire.

name: parthenon-completed
description: Athens finished the iconic temple dedicated to the goddess Athena.

name: great-wall-begins
description: Emperor Qin Shi Huang began connecting and extending defensive walls across China.

name: appian-way
description: Rome built its first major highway connecting the city to southern Italy.

name: library-alexandria-built
description: The ancient world's greatest library was constructed in Egypt.

name: colossus-rhodes
description: A giant bronze statue of the sun god Helios was erected at the harbor.

name: lighthouse-alexandria
description: One of the Seven Wonders was built to guide ships into the harbor.

name: terracotta-army
description: Thousands of clay soldiers were buried with China's first emperor.

name: pont-du-gard
description: Romans built the impressive aqueduct bridge in southern France.

name: colosseum-completed
description: Rome finished building its massive amphitheater for gladiatorial games.

name: pantheon-rebuilt
description: Emperor Hadrian rebuilt the Roman temple with its famous domed roof.

name: hadrians-wall
description: The Romans finished their defensive wall across northern Britain.

name: baths-caracalla
description: Rome opened one of the largest and most impressive public bath complexes.

name: constantinople-founded
description: Emperor Constantine established the new capital of the Roman Empire.

name: hagia-sophia-completed
description: The Byzantine cathedral with its massive dome was finished in Constantinople.

name: grand-canal-china
description: The Sui Dynasty completed major extensions to the world's longest canal.

name: dome-rock-completed
description: The Islamic shrine was built on the Temple Mount in Jerusalem.

name: nara-todaiji
description: Japan completed one of the world's largest wooden buildings housing a giant Buddha.

name: great-mosque-cordoba
description: The iconic mosque with its forest of columns reached its final form.

name: tower-london
description: William the Conqueror began construction of the iconic fortress.

name: angkor-wat-completed
description: The massive Hindu temple complex was finished in Cambodia.

name: notre-dame-paris-begins
description: Work began on the iconic Gothic cathedral in Paris.

name: leaning-tower-pisa
friendly_name: Leaning Tower of Pisa Construction Begins
description: Construction began on the bell tower that would famously begin to tilt.

name: chartres-cathedral
description: The French Gothic masterpiece with its famous stained glass was finished.

name: alhambra-expanded
description: The Nasrid dynasty expanded the stunning palace complex in Granada.

name: florence-dome
description: Brunelleschi finished the largest masonry dome ever built.

name: forbidden-city-completed
description: The massive imperial palace complex was finished in Beijing.

name: machu-picchu-built
description: The Inca constructed their famous citadel high in the Andes Mountains.

name: sistine-chapel-completed
description: The papal chapel was finished in Vatican City.

name: st-peters-basilica-begins
description: Work began on the world's largest church in Vatican City.

name: chateau-chambord
description: The French Renaissance castle with its distinctive roofline was completed.

name: st-basils-cathedral
description: The colorful onion-domed cathedral was finished in Moscow's Red Square.

name: rialto-bridge
description: Venice completed the oldest stone bridge across the Grand Canal.

name: taj-mahal-completed
description: The Mughal emperor finished the famous white marble mausoleum.

name: versailles-expanded
description: Louis XIV moved his court to the massively expanded palace.

name: st-pauls-completed
description: Christopher Wren finished rebuilding London's cathedral after the Great Fire.

name: buckingham-palace
description: The townhouse that would become the British monarch's residence was built.

name: winter-palace-completed
description: The Russian imperial residence in St. Petersburg was finished.

name: iron-bridge
description: The world's first major cast iron bridge opened in England.

name: white-house-completed
description: The official residence of the US President was finished in Washington DC.

name: erie-canal
description: The canal connecting the Great Lakes to the Atlantic Ocean opened.

name: first-railway
description: The Stockton and Darlington Railway became the world's first public railway.

name: brooklyn-bridge-begins
description: Work began on the first steel-wire suspension bridge.

name: suez-canal
description: The canal connecting the Mediterranean and Red Seas opened to shipping.

name: transcontinental-railroad
description: The first railroad spanning North America was completed at Promontory Summit.

name: brooklyn-bridge-completed
description: The iconic suspension bridge connecting Manhattan and Brooklyn opened.

name: statue-liberty
description: France's gift to America was unveiled in New York Harbor.

name: eiffel-tower
description: The iron lattice tower was built for the Paris World's Fair.

name: tower-bridge-london
description: London's iconic bascule bridge over the Thames opened.

name: trans-siberian-railway
description: The world's longest railway connecting Moscow to Vladivostok was finished.

name: flatiron-building
description: The distinctive triangular skyscraper opened in New York City.

name: panama-canal
description: The canal connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans opened to shipping.

name: lincoln-memorial
description: The memorial honoring Abraham Lincoln opened in Washington DC.

name: chrysler-building
description: The Art Deco skyscraper briefly became the world's tallest building.

name: empire-state-building
description: The iconic skyscraper became the world's tallest building for 40 years.

name: golden-gate-bridge
description: The iconic orange suspension bridge opened in San Francisco.

name: hoover-dam
description: The massive concrete dam on the Colorado River was finished.

name: pentagon-completed
description: The world's largest office building was finished in just 16 months.

name: autobahn-expanded
description: Germany's high-speed highway network reached over 2,000 miles.

name: united-nations-hq
description: The UN complex opened on the East River in New York City.

name: interstate-highway-begins
description: Construction began on America's national highway network.

name: sydney-opera-house-begins
description: Work began on the iconic Australian performing arts center.

name: berlin-wall-built
description: East Germany erected a wall dividing Berlin.

name: gateway-arch
description: The stainless steel monument was completed in St. Louis.

name: world-trade-center-begins
description: Work began on the Twin Towers in Lower Manhattan.

name: aswan-high-dam
description: Egypt completed the massive dam across the Nile River.

name: world-trade-center-completed
description: The Twin Towers opened as the world's tallest buildings.

name: sydney-opera-house-completed
description: The iconic performing arts venue opened after 14 years of construction.

name: sears-tower
description: The Chicago skyscraper became the world's tallest building.

name: cn-tower
description: The communications tower became Toronto's most recognizable landmark.

name: channel-tunnel-begins
description: Work began on the undersea tunnel connecting England and France.

name: chunnel-completed
description: The undersea rail tunnel connecting Britain and France opened.

name: petronas-towers
description: The twin skyscrapers became the world's tallest buildings in Kuala Lumpur.

name: hong-kong-airport
description: One of the world's largest and busiest airports opened on Lantau Island.

name: millennium-dome
description: The large dome structure opened in London for the millennium celebration.

name: tate-modern
description: A former power station was converted into London's modern art museum.

name: millau-viaduct
description: The world's tallest bridge opened in southern France.

name: taipei-101
description: The supertall skyscraper became the world's tallest building in Taiwan.

name: three-gorges-dam
description: The world's largest hydroelectric dam was finished on China's Yangtze River.

name: burj-khalifa
description: The world's tallest building opened in Dubai at 2,717 feet.

name: one-world-trade
description: The tallest building in the Western Hemisphere opened on the WTC site.

name: gotthard-base-tunnel
description: The world's longest railway tunnel opened through the Swiss Alps.

name: beijing-daxing-airport
description: The massive starfish-shaped airport opened as the world's largest single terminal.

name: crossrail-elizabeth-line
description: London's new cross-city railway opened after years of construction.
